result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul E Qualls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 9 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation if approval by a physician.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: with good time credit/Huber/Day Reporting Center.

Defendant Paul E Qualls in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS 6MONTHS with 9 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for  the WI Substance Abuse program, but is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision
- 7 months condition time with good time credit/ Huber/ Day Reporting Center
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation if approval by a physician.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Paul E Qualls in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 11/18/2015 is vacated.    Pursuant to negotiations, the Second and Subsequent enhancer is dismissed.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Paul E Qualls in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Steven Jegen. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 3. Defense requests the Court withdraw the not guilty plea in order to enter a request for substitution. Court allowed the defendant to withdraw the not guilty plea. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15. Defendant re-entered a not guilty plea to all counts. Court reviewed the justice point report with the parties. Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/5/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Paul E Qualls in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Paul E Qualls in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
